data.text: @AdamWagner1 5 years... There is a part of me that thinks what's the point. I guess it's a legacy of understanding for the future, but it just feels irrelevant for individuals lives. This will do little for the victims of covid, perhaps they will need to find "personal meaning" themselves.

@helenessex2 @AdamWagner1 Human rights are seen as inalienable and not contingent on whether there is an outbreak of an infectious disease.  I have some sympathy with your position (despite being broadly anti-lockdown), because I think the whole concept of human rights is well-meaning nonsense. 🙂

@AdamWagner1 Here are some of the examples  with how ideas of liberty have been misused imo. ie mask use has been so controversial here, especially for children, it’s framed as abusive. For me ironic that huge backlash against most measures to reduce spread result in ⬆️infections =sick≠ free https://t.co/jfWPfqrlr5
@AdamWagner1 Why lockdowns were needed in the first place? This seems to be largely forgotten.

@AdamWagner1 Adam I’d really appreciate understanding more of why emphasis must be on human rights & lockdown? You mention right to life but loss of liberty has been used disingenuously throughout I would say, to trump basic protections for right to life. Wud this emphasis detract from…
@AdamWagner1 @libertyhq Thank you Adam - a problem also with the #Grenfell inquiry terms of reference

@AdamWagner1 @covidinquiryuk If I were Baroness Hallett I'd appoint a couple of deputy chairs to share the burden and run aspects of the Inquiry focused on the clinical responses.  Someone like, say, @Johnrashton47 or @trishgreenhalgh ...
@AdamWagner1 @libertyhq Certainly they should look at policing and how care homes were forced to take infected patients back from hospitals. And corruption in the awarding of covid contracts.
